text: The Administration’s attempt to roll back the Roadless Rule threatens nearly 28,000 acres in Monterey County. I’m am a co-sponsor of the Roadless Area Conservation Act to protect our forests, watersheds, and wildfire resilience for generations. https://t.co/QzedSSEjkA

Great to meet with local producers from CA-19 to discuss the future of organic farming. Strengthening supply chains, reducing barriers for farmers, and maintaining trust in the organic label are essential to supporting our producers and growing this vital part of our local and national economy.

This is good. But the fact that this show was pulled in the first place after threats from the FCC is a dangerous threat to the First Amendment. That’s why the House Oversight Committee must continue investigating the FCC’s role. We must not allow government intimidation of free speech.
https://t.co/06nrBeb0GE

Our democracy was founded on the principle that people, not politicians, choose their representatives. That’s why I joined Rep Zoe Lofgren & Sen. Alex Padilla to introduce the Redistricting Reform Act to ban gerrymandering, require independent redistricting commissions nationwide, and strengthen our democracy.

To all who are celebrating, I wish you a sweet, healthy, and fulfilling new year. Shanah Tovah! May this Rosh Hashanah bring peace, joy, and renewal to you, your families, and our communities. https://t.co/BHldwclaRt

After a constituent lost retirement savings in a scam, I helped them work with the IRS to reduce their tax burden. The forms were accepted, and they now have peace of mind. I will continue my fight to make government work for those who need it most. https://t.co/PUUvyTCQLE

Speaker Johnson did not negotiate whatsoever to try to make the Continuing Resolution for the budget bipartisan.  Instead, the Majority wants to stick with the same budget that cuts health care for working families so that billionaires can get a tax break. A budget that adds trillions to the debt. That’s not a clean CR, that’s just dirty. That’s why we are at a standoff. Speaker Johnson needs to stop playing partisan politics and negotiate a bipartisan budget.

The FCC’s political interference and pressure on networks is a direct attack on the First Amendment. That chilling effect on free speech is unacceptable. An investigation in the Oversight Committee is needed into this abuse of power.
https://t.co/LO5QstJuI4

When a constituent couldn’t get any answers about her federal health insurance, she called my office. I worked with OPM to resolve the issue, helping her recover $2,496 in premium reimbursements and increase her monthly annuity. Despite the dysfunction in Washington, I’m not getting distracted from delivering for you here in CA-19. If you're having an issue with a federal agency, please contact me for help.

Honored to join @CureSMA to recognize their work empowering families and advocating for those living with spinal muscular atrophy. I will keep pushing for all Disabled Adult Children to ensure their benefits if they get married. They shouldn’t have to choose between benefits and love.

I joined my bipartisan co-chairs of the Ag Trade Caucus to highlight why Congress must take back its constitutional trade authorities. Farmers and ranchers deserve real agreements and stronger, more robust markets. Congress must step up and deliver for our producers and keep American agriculture strong.

In just a few hours, I’ll be hosting another telephone town hall on Sec. RFK Jr. and his views on science and public health.
 
📞 Call in at 5:30 PM: 833-380-0413
💻 Stream: https://t.co/6CVcyiWIAd https://t.co/3NYptgpyZL

Families are already feeling the squeeze of higher costs. Now this Administration and this Majority have cut health care and put millions at risk of losing coverage. I will keep fighting to restore ACA subsidies and lower costs so every American can access affordable care.
https://t.co/2uvk8bIu2x

Yet this Administration’s tariff policy has driven up prices, hurt jobs, shaken markets, and strained our alliances, all while bypassing Congress.
 
Families, small businesses, farmers, and manufacturers in CA-19 and across the country are being crushed by these high costs. They do not have the margins to survive these tariffs, nor the backroom access to secure exemptions. It is time for Congress to reclaim its constitutional role, repeal the excessive tariff powers we’ve ceded to the Executive Branch, and put people over politics. That is our duty to our constituents, to the Constitution, and to the country.

On the House floor, I fought against a rule that gives up Congress’s constitutional authority over trade.
 
Article I of the Constitution makes clear that Congress, not the President, has the power over foreign commerce. https://t.co/TwrNGjohOt

I met with agricultural leaders to discuss priorities on animal health, labor, and trade. Their perspective helps guide my work in Congress to strengthen American agriculture and support the farmers and producers who feed our nation. https://t.co/8t2XMUZguA

Tonight at 5:30 PM, I’ll be joined by public health experts for a town hall on vaccines, science, and community health under Sec. RFK Jr..
 
Join us:
📞 833-380-0413
💻 https://t.co/6CVcyiWIAd https://t.co/vMJlopvRom

A constituent came to my office deeply worried about his immigration status. I connected him with resources and made sure that his issues were solved. Having grown up here from a family that immigrated here, I have always fought for those willing to come here, play by the rules, and work hard to give their children a better life.  That’s why I will continue to fight for people to have opportunity here.

Tomorrow at 5:30 PM, I’m hosting another town hall with key experts on this Administration’s public health policies under Sec. RFK Jr. and the effect on the health of Americans.
 
📞 Call in: 833-380-0413

As Hispanic Heritage Month begins, I’m proud to celebrate the rich history, culture, and contributions of our Latino communities. Their stories shape our nation and strengthen California’s 19th Congressional District and our country. I look forward to honoring that legacy. https://t.co/GrkfWLOcHP

The Administration’s cuts to Medicaid are forcing states into a chaotic competition just to keep rural hospitals open. That’s wrong. Patients deserve stable, fair support they can count on, and that’s what I’m fighting for. 
https://t.co/Jmljl0gH2w

Honored to meet with Gold Star families ahead of Gold Star Families Remembrance Week. Their courage and sacrifice remind us of the true cost of service. I’m committed to ensuring survivor families receive the support and benefits they have earned. https://t.co/uI2wkehEeY

Larry deGhetaldi dedicated his life to making health care more accessible for our community. His leadership, advocacy, and kindness left a lasting mark on Santa Cruz, CA-19, and beyond. We are grateful for his service and example, and my thoughts are with his loved ones.

While deployed, a U.S. Army officer missed thousands in TSP contributions. I worked with DFAS to recover over $18,000 in missed and misapplied funds. Soldiers shouldn’t have to battle bureaucracy while serving our country, and I’m proud to step in when they do. https://t.co/HltRwAjaN3

The Administration is once again attacking workers and trying to strip protections. Good to work with Senator Warren & Rep. Sherman on legislation to support workers. 
https://t.co/6yJLcPlUB7

Always grateful to meet with veterans from CA-19. Their advocacy is for our responsibility to ensure those who served receive the benefits, care, and opportunities they’ve earned. We must honor that commitment every day. https://t.co/0Nu2f1ggAF

Monarch butterflies are iconic to California’s 19th Congressional District and essential to our ecosystems, but their survival depends on us. I’m proud to author and continue to lead legislation to invest in habitat restoration, protect overwintering sites, and strengthen pollinator conservation across our nation.

Rolling back the Public Lands Rule threatens the conservation of our shared spaces. BLM lands safeguard wildlife, water, and communities. 
https://t.co/8pEYymrvDC

One of my constituents reached out for help with their 2024 tax refund. I worked with the IRS and was able to get their $2,480 refund processed in less than two months. I’ll always work to ensure my constituents get the support they’ve earned. https://t.co/rngUJxzZAg

Congratulations to Patrice: The Movie on its Emmy win! This powerful film brings attention to the injustice that forces disabled adults to choose between their right to marry and their access to essential benefits.

With the Marriage Equality for Disabled Adults Act, we can finally end this outdated penalty and affirm that every person deserves the dignity, security, and freedom to build a life with the person they love. Here’s to progress, equality, and more stories like Patrice and Lori Long’s leading the way.
https://t.co/ECMk68zAxA

Families are already struggling with the high cost of health care, and the Administration’s proposed drug tariffs would drive premiums even higher. We should be lowering costs, protecting coverage, and building a system where every American can afford the care they need. That is why Congress must reclaim its Constitutional control over trade.
https://t.co/QrmIkCsxCg

Local service organizations make our communities stronger, yet their impact too often goes unrecognized. Our bipartisan resolution establishing Celebrate Community Week honors their service, uplifts their example, and reminds us of the importance of civic responsibility.
https://t.co/mUdn8LNKen

Had a great discussion with biofuel leaders about the future of clean energy. By expanding access to homegrown fuels and advancing innovative solutions, we can support our producers, strengthen our economy, and build a more sustainable future for our nation. https://t.co/C55crFaHkN

Housing costs are squeezing families across the country, from record mortgage payments to rents rising faster than inflation. The Census Bureau’s new data makes clear what so many working families in CA-19 already know: the cost of housing is out of control.
 
We need to take a comprehensive approach to housing affordability, from the bottom up.
 
My Workforce Housing Tax Credit Act would increase the supply of affordable housing for middle-income families who earn too much to qualify for low-income housing and not enough to afford a home near where they work. My First-Time Homebuyer Tax Credit Act would provide qualifying first-time homebuyers with a $15,000 tax credit toward the purchase of a new home, providing them with the support that is needed to build wealth and put down roots in our communities. My More Homes on the Market Act would double the capital gains exemption on home sales and allow homeowners looking to downsize to do so without sacrificing their nest eggs. We need to provide real relief for renters through the Rent Relief Act, further expand the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit, and incentivize the use of Project-Based Vouchers.
 
We can and must make affordable housing a priority, and I’ll keep pushing to ensure every family has the chance to put down roots and build a future in our communities.
 
https://t.co/8ikMKpY0KH

When a constituent’s work permit was stuck in limbo, I stepped in to help get it expedited. With our support, USCIS processed her case and lifted the uncertainty. I’ll keep fighting for timely solutions for our immigrant communities. https://t.co/QHfLrJViF2

Speaker Mike Johnson continues to placate the President by abdicating the power of Congress under Article One of the Constitution. Our democracy depends on checks and balances.

Since Speaker Johnson became Speaker of the House, more than 74,000 Americans have been killed by gun violence. Tragically, gun violence is now the leading cause of death for children, teens, and even law enforcement officers.

Joined local veterans, retirees, and military families at this year’s Retiree Appreciation Day at the Presidio of Monterey. From expanding VA access to helping local vets recover pensions, resolve claims, and access health care, my office is here to serve those who served us. Thank you to everyone who continues to strengthen our military community in CA-19.

Our community in North San Luis Obispo County continues to stand with our neighbors impacted by the Gifford Fire. The Paso Robles Horse Park (3801 Hughes Parkway, Paso Robles, CA 93446) has offered to take large animal evacuees and has stalls available. Call 805-369-1323 for more information.

The Gifford Fire is burning south of our district, but its growth is a reminder that we must be ready before disaster strikes. 

If you live in a wildfire-prone area, take steps now to protect yourself, your family, and your property:
 
✅ Sign up for local emergency alerts from Cal Fire and your county OES
✅ Prepare an emergency supply kit with essentials, medications, documents, and pet needs
✅ Clear flammable vegetation and debris from around your home
✅ Park your car facing your evacuation route and keep the tank full
✅ Keep doors and windows closed but unlocked for firefighter access
✅ Have at least two evacuation routes planned, by foot and by car
 
Stay informed, stay prepared, and stay safe. For more resources, visit: https://t.co/1KQG4G5Yfa

This week’s Supreme Court ruling curtailed the judiciary’s ability to check executive overreach. Courts have used nationwide injunctions to temporarily block federal policies with widespread impact while legal challenges proceed. That tool ensured that when a federal court found a presidential action likely unconstitutional, the harm could be paused across the country, not just in a single state.
 
Now, the Court has limited that power. Instead of stopping a potentially unlawful executive order nationwide, judges can only issue relief in the states or districts that bring the challenge, unless challengers file class action suits. That means the same executive order can be blocked in California but enforced in Texas. This ruling also delays, but doesn’t prevent, the implementation of President Trump’s executive order attempting to reinterpret the 14th Amendment, an amendment that has guaranteed citizenship to those born on U.S. soil since 1868. For now, the Supreme Court has not ruled on the merits of that challenge. The fight continues. 
https://t.co/M10FUvziIz

These tariffs are undermining our national security and credibility, particularly in the Indo-Pacific. If this administration truly wants to counter China and build alliances, this is the wrong way to do it.

I know the President says we’re getting screwed. But the truth is, the President is screwing us. His inchoate tariff policy is making our economy weaker, our families poorer, and our position in the world less secure.

I’ll continue pushing for free trade agreements that open markets and lower costs, without gutting the very economy we’re trying to strengthen.

The supposed national emergency is based on the idea that any trade deficit is a loss. That’s not how trade works. Our economy chooses to import and invest abroad for a reason: cheaper goods, increased purchasing power, and competitive markets. Trump’s approach ignores our $250 billion annual trade surplus in services, and the fact that dollars sent abroad often return in the form of foreign investment.

This policy is not about sound economics. Its nostalgia wrapped in nationalism. It’s driven by a 40-year fetish for tariffs, not by the realities of the 21st-century economy.
Tariffs are taxes. And Americans would be the ones to pay them.

President Trump’s 10% across-the-board tariff regime is 10 times larger than what was in place when he took office. It’s one of the largest self-imposed tax increases in modern American history, costing working families over $3,800 a year. It triggered one of the most volatile 3-day market downturns since WWII. It’s a policy rooted in the false belief that trade deficits are inherently bad and that tariffs are paid by foreign countries, not American consumers and businesses.

I spoke candidly about the incoherence of the Trump administration’s tariff regime and the real harm it's inflicting on working families, American businesses, and our national security. https://t.co/nxtb2QuaJH

This Administration continues to make our country weaker. The President’s 40-year fetish with tariffs is causing market volatility and shaking confidence in our economy. These fluctuations aren’t the result of any outside disaster, just Trump's poor decisions.

As a member of Congress, I take pride in helping my constituents navigate the federal system, and I know many of my colleagues do too. Social Security casework is one of the most critical services we provide. We push the agency to get results, to cut through the red tape, and to ensure people get the benefits they are entitled to. But when this administration actively dismantles the SSA, I’m going to fight back with everything I can to protect the people I serve.

In California’s 19th Congressional District alone, over 140,000 people rely on Social Security, receiving $282 million in monthly benefits, including 120,000 retirees, 5,000 children, and 8,000 disabled workers. 

These cuts will directly impact them by increasing wait times, limiting access to services, and making it harder for them to receive the benefits they have earned.

The American people have earned their Social Security benefits, and they need a federal government that ensures those benefits are delivered, promptly, efficiently, and without unnecessary obstacles. 

Unfortunately, this administration, under the direction of Elon Musk and Doge, is doing the exact opposite by gutting the Social Security Administration (SSA), slashing its workforce by 12%, and shutting down nearly 50 field offices.

Safeguarding Social Security, Medicare, and tax refunds is not negotiable. We will not allow sensitive financial data to be handed over for political or private gain.
Calling for Independent Reviews: We’re urging the Treasury Inspector General and GAO to immediately investigate potential violations of taxpayer privacy laws.
Launching Oversight Investigations: We will push for hearings and investigations into how and why Musk was given access—and ensure taxpayer data isn’t exploited.
Demanding Accountability: We’re pushing for strong protections in the government funding bill to stop any misuse of taxpayer dollars.
Introducing New Legislation: We’re drafting a bill to revoke unauthorized access, strengthen security, and prevent political appointees from unilaterally exposing taxpayer data.
Blocking Unlawful Access: We are evaluating legal options and pursuing action against this dangerous overreach. Legal challenges are imminent.

As demonstrated earlier this week, there is a bipartisan governing majority, including myself, that is ready to negotiate and pass legislation, including the original CR that would keep the government open and begin to tackle several serious challenges facing our country.
When hard working Americans don’t get paid or don’t get the services that we deserve from our federal government, that’s when people get hurt.

However, due to the pressure of the President-elect and an unaccountable billionaire, Speaker Johnson went against his best interests and the interests of the American people, and is just over 24 hours from shutting down the federal government.

Due to Republicans' slim majority and their division and dysfunction that has been demonstrated throughout he 118th Congress, Speaker Johnson knows that he cannot pass a CR, or anything else for that matter, without negotiating with Democrats, plain and simple.

Tonight, Speaker Johnson put forward another CR that included a two year extension of the debt-ceiling. His legislation was not negotiated with Democrats and that is why it failed miserably on the House floor with 38 Republicans voting against it.
Unfortunately, Speaker Johnson, and many others in his party, then caved under pressure from President-elect Trump and Musk and broke their commitment to the Democrats and to the deal.

Yesterday, President-elect Trump, at the 11th hour, demanded that a deal for the debt ceiling be included in the CR, so that he doesn’t have to negotiate it with the Democrats next year. Elon Musk also posted that he was against the CR.

The legislation included a number of significant provisions for our nation’s farmers and disaster relief, as well a few of my bills for CA-19. The Speaker negotiated the legislation in good faith and gave his word that he would see through the deal and keep open the government.

Earlier this week, Congressional Democrats and Republicans reached a bipartisan deal for a continuing resolution (CR) to fund and keep open the federal government. 

Here's how we got to the brink of a shutdown and how we can move forward 🧵

While the road is now structurally repaired and reopened, our work is far from over. The next step is to secure additional funding to repave and further enhance the road’s long-term usability and resilience.
We attended local meetings, engaged with stakeholders, and listened to community concerns every step of the way.
From day one, my team and I worked with urgency and persistence to secure this funding, coordinate with the Federal Highway Administration, and ensure that this critical project stayed on track.
In 2022, I secured significant federal funding through the Emergency Relief for Federally Owned Roads (ERFO) program to restore Nacimiento-Fergusson Road.

This road isn’t just a scenic byway, it’s a lifeline for residents, a gateway to our treasured Los Padres National Forest, and an essential safety route when Highway 1, beautiful as it is, proves unreliable due to frequent closures caused by slides, floods, and fires.

Great news for our community along the Big Sur coast, Nacimiento-Fergusson Road has officially reopened! This milestone marks an essential step forward for the quality of life, safety, and connectivity of our region. 🧵
